tit.e: Shinseki Koka (demotion from nobility to subject)

sen.j: 臣籍降下（しんせきこうか）とは、皇族がその身分を離れ、姓を与えられ臣下の籍に降りることをいう。
sen.e: Shinseki koka means the Imperial family leave their position and become subject from the nobility after given new surname.
Shinseki koka is when a member of the Imperial family leaves their position and becomes a common subject giving up their nobility status, after given a new surname.

sen.e: It is also called Shiseikoka, and those Imperial members are called Shisei (Imperial family who were given the surname) Imperial family.

sen.e: When Female member of the Imperial family married to the subject and leave the Imperial family was called Shinseki koka. (demotion from nobility to subject)

sen.j: 律令においては、4世王までは皇親となり、5世王は皇親とはならないものの王号を有し従五位下の蔭位を受け、6世王は王号を得られないものとされた（もっとも、慶雲3年2月の格で変更あり)。
sen.e: Under s statute, Kings up to the fourth Kings are considered as members of the Imperial family, those who are more than fifth Kings are not considered as the Imperial family, however they still have the rank as King and receive the On I of the junior grade of the fifth Court rank, lower grade, the Kings more than 6th Kings are not allowed to have the rank of the King. (However the rank was changed in February Keiun 3.)

Under the statute, up to 4 emperors removed, relatives are still considered as members of the Imperial family, those who are more than 5 emperors removed are not considered as members of the Imperial family, however they still have the rank as emperor and receive the On I of the junior grade of the fifth Court rank, lower grade, those with more than 6 emperors removed are not allowed to have the rank of the emperor. (However the rank was changed in February Keiun 3.)
